content.rendered:
It’s a new day
One for which
I did not pay

It’s new to me
And new to you
what will we see
and what will we do

I do not know
Will I shrink
or will I grow
Shrink in fear
Or grow in knowledge

Will I be better today
Than I was yesterday
Or will I stay the same
Or grow in fame
Will I die to self
And learn to live
Will I keep
Or choose to give

Who knows
What the day will bring
Will it be different
Or the same
Is life a burden
Or is it a game
I give you my time
I sell it for a dime

Is it over now
Or just getting started
Will I glow bright
Or flame be retarded
Will I be a start
Shine from afar
Can you see my light

Can you see me fight
To resist myself
To lay in bed
And lay my head
And close my eyes
Or go instead

To go out
And change my world
To change myself
To be the same
Or build a shelf

To do something
For someone else
Of for myself
With someone else

To be alone
Or be with you
In mine own zoo

 It is of the Lord’s mercies that we are not consumed, because his compassions fail not. They are new every morning: great is thy faithfulness. The Lord is my portion, saith my soul; therefore will I hope in him. Lamentations 3:22-24 (KJV)
